pageContext.description: Typology: most of bl. broad v. sl. convex midrib with marked concave e. bevs; bevels terminate in abrupt offsets below shoulders; v. thin but flattened ricassos; tang sides also mainly flat; midridge at tang and shoulders with concave flanking faces; bevelled surfaces around parts of rivet holes; tang end chisel-edged.,Condition: v. sharp edges, v. little dam.; sl. bend in length - tang-skew,Attached Material: blocking one rivet hole - poss. small gravel chip
pageContext.patina: Patches of olivey-brown sur. - poss. orig. p.; other patches fairly bright gold - not interference; rest rich to dark greens - lumpy and flaked
pageContext.collection: London, Society of Antiquities Collection, B.24,(Presented 1860 by  Sudlow Roots, esq., from the collection of his father William Roots - No. 14)
pageContext.site: Greater London,River Thames,Kingston,"found in the Thames at Kingston 7 feet under the gravelly bottom, and nearly 2 feet deep in the blue clay, close to the missile hatchets and other arms found at the same place." (no's 5&6) (c)
pageContext.toSearch: Kingston Upon Thames, Greater London, UK
pageContext.remarks: Labels/Markings: White ink inscr. "B24", loose hand painted label.,PIF, DF(C), SI; C; Rec. SN Feb.79; Source MV; Old Cards 1
